CodeplexIssue.Title: Error when trying to get Excel.Selection.Name.Name
CodeplexIssue.DescriptionHtml:
If I name cell A1, "MyCell", and select that cell, then in VBA I can do the following:
Debug.Print Application.Selection.Name & " ... " & Application.Selection.Name.Name
=Sheet1!$A$1 ... MyCell
I can't seem to make this work from within NetOffice. Instead I get the following:
Debug.Print Application.Selection.Name.ToString
NetOffice.ExcelApi.Name
Am I stuck? Is there some other way to get the cell name of the currently selected cell via NetOffice?
Thanks, Mike

CodeplexComment.Author: SebastianDotNet
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml:
as hotfix: change: Application.Selection.Name.Name to: Application.Selection.Name.get_Name()
i fix the issue tomorrow *sorry Sebastian

CodeplexComment.Author: mwolfe02
CodeplexComment.BodyHtml: Wow...impressive response time. I downloaded the new release and it seems to be working. Thanks!
